Case reference: 2015050965.CaseDesc: On October 29th, 1973 Kenneth Roy was reported missing from the Nepisiguit River area approximately 75-80 miles from Bathurst, New Brunswick. Kenneth had left to go on a hunting trip alone and was known to be an experienced woodsman.

Chain: Compass hanging on a shoelace and worn as a necklace
Hat: Red, Beige, Cap, Reversible to blue
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, With expansion bracelet

Case reference: 2018053566.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1995, at approximately 8:30am, Robert Walmsley was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Robert was scheduled to meet with his sister the following day, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2014003086.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1997, Maurizio Di Caprio was last seen in Montreal. He left for Chicoutimi or Toronto to bring a vehicle back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2006017399.CaseDesc: Mary Frances Gregory left her home in Parry Sound, Ontario on February 15, 1978, to vacation in California. She failed to arrive at her destination in Palo Alto, California and has not contacted any family members or friends since. Ms. Gregory is believed to have departed Canada by motor vehicle with a male acquaintance who states that he let her off at a bus station in Las Vegas, Nevada some ten days after leaving Canada. The driver claims to have driven to Nevada via the States of New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Illinois, Colorado, Utah, and Arizona.

Mark: Right Abdomen, Brown, in shape of 5 cent piece (10mm)

Case reference: 2014001691.CaseDesc: Norman Krolman was last seen withdrawing money from an ATM machine.  He was a self-employed computer programmer and was in business with a partner.  He had a steady girlfriend and a small circle of friends.

Case reference: 2009004199.CaseDesc: Manou Sokpor was reported missing to police by his fiancée. She had last spoken with Manou at 2:00 a.m. on May 14th, 2009 by telephone; nothing seemed out of the ordinary. His fiancée had no further contact with Manou the rest of that day which was out of his character. On May 15th the vehicle Manou usually drove was located in his driveway, and his wallet and cellular phone were in the bedroom.

Teeth: Visible Missing, First or second molar upper left jaw, gap in front teeth.

Case reference: 2022005356.CaseDesc: On November 25, 2021, Krystine Scott was seen for the last time in Windsor, Ontario. Krystine is known to lead a transient lifestyle, but it is not in her nature to be out of contact with her friends and family for an extended period.

Case reference: 2014001591.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1997, Gordon Mertz was seen for the last time at the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) on East White Hills road in St. John's, Newfoundland. Gordon worked as a Fisheries Scientist, and records show that he logged off of his computer and left the building shortly after 5:15 p.m.

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976

Case reference: 2012020646.CaseDesc: Antonie Medzech was last seen outside the Midtown Plaza in downtown Saskatoon, Saskatchewan at approximately 8:00 a.m. on December 13, 2002. Antonie had been dropped off at that location to go shopping.

Jewelry: Leather, Watch, silver face, black strap

Case reference: 2014003900.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1977 at approximately 3 p.m., Ronald Foucault left his father’s business located in the city of Blainville, Quebec and told his father he had to travel to Texas, in the United States for work. There has been no news from Ronald since this time and it is impossible to confirm his arrival in the United States. In 1979, some of his belongings were found near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018016431.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, Crystal Hackett was seen for the last time in Lloydminster, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Crystal may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Jaw, Thin white scar on the right side of jaw

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2016069147.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1974, the body of a Caucasian male was found on the CNR tracks, 200 yards west of the CNR Station, Hearst. A witness observed the remains on the tracks after an advancing train had passed. His post-mortem length was recorded as being 5’8” however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was described as having a medium build. He may have been wearing glasses according to police reports.

Teeth: Good, Missing upper left 3rd molar. Several of his upper and lower posterior teeth had amalgam restorations.

Case reference: 2015066998.CaseDesc:
Yvon Shawn Guignard moved to the northern part of Manitoba during the summer of 2015 in search of employment, with interests in Churchill and the Northwest Territories. While in Thompson, he adopted a transient lifestyle, living in his personal vehicle and developing friendships with the homeless community. 
It’s believed Mr. Guignard was last seen on November 28, 2015 at approximately 6:45am. Just prior to his disappearance, he made a number of attempts to give away his personal vehicle, which was located at the time he was reported missing. According to his family, he is schizophrenic, with a medical condition and he also has a history of not taking his prescription medications. He has been known to travel to undisclosed locations within the country and act secretive with family as to his whereabouts. He should not be approached as he may be in medical distress.

Case reference: 2014003232.CaseDesc: Warren Grundy was reported missing from Edmonton, Alberta, in June 1983. Warren's personal identification and clothing were later found near the North Saskatchewan river bank below the High Level Bridge in Edmonton. Warren may have been sighted in Ontario two and a half years after he disappeared. There was also suggestion that he may have travelled to Ohio, USA.

Case reference: 2014005960.CaseDesc: On December 26th, 2012 at approximately 11:45 am Raymond Nothdurft was last observed near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Raymond was despondent.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Wears a moustache
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Left Ring Finger, Three to four small diamonds in a diagonal
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Ring, Right Little Finger, No lettering or logo
Scar: Right Knee, Small laparoscopic surgical scar on knee cap
Left Knee, Small laparoscopic surgical scar on knee cap
Tattoo: Right Ankle, Soccer ball with red maple leaf on outside

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2019042986.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1987, at approximately 8:15am, Anna Lippert was last seen at the Etobicoke General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006195.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2004, Randy Boudreau was last seen at his residence in Campbellton, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014002598.CaseDesc: Tina Fang Chen arrived in Canada from China in May 2000 and stayed in Mississauga Ontario for approximately 3 weeks, until her disappearance on June 9, 2000.  It is believed that she had the intention to enter the USA and was possibly headed for New York State.

Case reference: 2014005323.CaseDesc: Darrell Hoshowski was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta, in July 1983. Prior to his disappearance, Darrell had made a withdrawal from his bank account. There is reason to believe that he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia or possibly to the State of California, in the USA.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014005532.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1984, Emily Koble had been picked up by two ladies that felt she had appeared lost and confused. Emily was dropped off near Christopher Lake, Saskatchewan when she asked to get out of the vehicle. The ladies called the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, however, a search failed to locate her.

Deformity: Shoulders, Steel pin, unknown which shoulder

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar

Case reference: 2021009119.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2021, Amber Ellis was reported missing by her mother. Amber communicated with her friends and family, including her two children, on a regular basis prior to her disappearance. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Thigh, Scar from a stab wound

Case reference: 2013000096.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1972 a four man fishing and trapping team was returning from Lynn Lake on dog sleds after purchasing supplies. Mr. Bonner and his friend were in the lead sled. The team that was traveling with them was approximately 2.5 km behind. When approximately 183 metres from Mr. Bonner's sled, they noticed both men had gone through the ice. Once on scene both men had disappeared beneath the water. One of the men was pulled from the water but could not be revived. Mr. Bonner never resurfaced and despite dragging operations he could not be located.

Case reference: 2014004511.CaseDesc: On July 29, 2004 George Davis left a residence near Creston, BC to get cigarettes. He was driving a 1981 brown Chrysler Lebaron with a British Columbia licence plate. The vehicle has not been recovered.

Mark: Eyes, Mole lower lid right eye

Case reference: 2014005155.CaseDesc: Harold Murray Harvey was seen for the last time by a neighbour in front of his residence in Pincourt on September 14, 2008. Mr. Harvey was reported missing by a family member on September 19, 2008. At the time of his disappearance he was taking medication, which he left behind. Mr. Harvey had left his home a few times in the past but always returned after a couple of days.

Case reference: 2014004721.CaseDesc: Belinda Gertrude Williams was last seen by her sister and father in July 1976 in Vancouver. Ms. Williams was not reported missing until February 2004 to the Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police in Mt. Currie, BC.  Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police determined that Ms. Williams was last seen in Mission, BC.

Scar: Eyes, Below eye, unknown which eye

Case reference: 2014006535.CaseDesc: On the 11th of July, 1972, Edward Nemanishen was last seen by co-workers at a work site approximately 12 km North West of Spruce Home in the Alingly District of Saskatchewan. Edward was working at the site clearing farmland at 1:30 pm. A co-worker returned to the work site at 7:00 pm and Edward was gone from the site. No one has seen or heard from him since that time.

Boots: Brown, Work boot; lace up; size 8
Sweater: Dark Green, Pullover with half zipper
Deformity: Ears, white lump behind right ear; the size of a pea

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2012020141.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1999, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Julie Surprenant was seen for the last time as she got off of a bus in the neighbourhood of L’Île St-Jean, in Montreal, Quebec. None of the clothing that she had worn that day were found at her residence; which suggests that Julie did not go home after getting off of the bus.

Coat: Leather, Brown, With the top plaid
Tattoo: Buttocks, dragon, size of a quarter

Case reference: 2014005676.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2011, Jimmy Larrivée was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Jimmy had indicated that he wanted to spend the day in Rigaud, Quebec. That day, he was seen at a tanning salon on Monk Boulevard in the Ville-Émard District of Montreal. Jimmy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Jewelry: Brown, Necklace with a cross-shaped pendant
Scar: Upper Left Back, Left shoulder blade

Case reference: 2008005999.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1978, Brian McLean and his co-worker, Russell Thomas, were commercial fishing at their camp on MacDowell Lake, near MacDowell Lake First Nation Territory. Mr. Thomas advised that they left in separate boats to lift nets. He went to the west side of the lake and pulled four nets, then to the east side of the lake and lifted two more nets. He then realized that Mr. McLean was not there. Mr. Thomas headed back towards the camp and found Mr. McLean’s boat washed up against the shore approximately three or four hundred metres from the camp. The motor was in forward gear with the throttle off, and the paddle was missing from the boat. MacDowell Lake is 90 "air miles" north of Red Lake, and is accessible only by air. The area was searched, and the lake was dragged, but Brian McLean has not been found.

Pants: Oilskin, Green, Coveralls with blue suspenders
Amputation: Right Foot, all toes except big toe left

Case reference: 2006018399.CaseDesc: David Sawyer and his girlfriend were last seen on May 17, 1977. They went fishing for the day on Pickerel Lake. Their capsized canoe was recovered but Mr. Sawyer has not been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2006020099.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1974, Louis Wesley was last seen in Chamberlain Narrows, Lac Seul. He was involved in a boating accident and is presumed to have drowned in the lake, 48 km north of Hudson. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014002821.CaseDesc: During the weekend of August 18, 1972, Dennis Simpson and a friend left for a fishing trip on McMillian Lake. When they failed to return by the 22nd, numerous people contacted police. Through investigation it was later determined that both men were last seen by a man on shore on Sunday the 20th, and their camp was still set up. They told the individual that they were going to make one more pass and then intended to break camp. Weather conditions at the time were such that there would have been rough water. Given this and the fact that the men were in a fairly small canoe, it was determined they may have capsized. An extensive land, water and air search did not find anything other than various articles that were identified as belonging to the two missing fishermen. Mr. Simpson has never been located.

Case reference: 2014004671.CaseDesc: Murphy Quill was last seen in mid-July 2005. His family and friends are concerned for his well being as it is unusual for him to be out of contact for this length of time. Although he does not have a fixed address, Mr. Quill is known to frequent the Main Street strip and the area near 75 Martha Street in Winnipeg, MB.

Case reference: 2014004257.CaseDesc: On March 24, 2003, Paul David Garcia was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Mr. Garcia left home in March 1997 leaving his vehicle and personal effects behind.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2014005145.CaseDesc: Sometime after July 30, 1939, Charles "Henry" Baxter went missing from the Hawarden District, SK. At the time of his disappearance, it was thought that Charles "Henry" went across the river to Tichfield to find work, or even joined the military and went overseas. However, Charles "Henry" was never seen again by his family, and these theories have never been substantiated.

Case reference: 2019048180.CaseDesc: On August, 11, 2019, Miranda Belle was seen for the last time by her ex-spouse at a family gathering in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Miranda was last heard from via Facebook, on August 17, 2019.

Case reference: 2013000028.CaseDesc: Leonette Purcell has not been seen or heard from since she disappeared on December 16, 2004, from her Grand Lake home situated near the Halifax International Airport. The circumstances of Mrs. Purcell's disappearance are suspicious and foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014003161.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1985, Andrew Pasztor was reported missing in Richmond, British Columbia.  Andrew had left home with the family vehicle which was later found at a restaurant in North Vancouver.  Andrew has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Beige, Vinyl with imitation fur collar

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2014004068.CaseDesc: Alexandra Sawicki disappeared from her home in Mississauga, Ontario, on November 13, 2000. She was driving a burgundy 1998 Dodge Neon with 4 doors. Mrs. Sawicki drove to Niagara Falls, Ontario and parked her car in the parking lot by the falls, where it was found abandoned by the Police later that evening. Mrs. Sawicki may have been upset and distraught. She speaks fluent English, Romanian and Hungarian.

Scar: Eyes, Right side of the right eye

Case reference: 2014002539.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, Amelie McArthur’s vehicle was found running with the lights on and the driver’s side door open on the Taylor Bridge in Taylor, BC. Amelie was last seen leaving her home in Taylor in that vehicle earlier that morning.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2022061830.CaseDesc: Ashley Shingoose was last seen on March 11, 2022 in Winnipeg, Manitoba.  She has not been seen or heard from since. Ashley led a high-risk lifestyle and was frequently seen by various agencies within Winnipeg, including shelters and various hospitals.

Case reference: 2014002093.CaseDesc: Wilhemina (Winnie) Wanner went missing from her home on January 3rd, 1989 in Red Deer, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005121.CaseDesc: On May 10, 2008, Marie Claude Chrétien spent part of the evening at home building a campfire with neighbours. She was last seen by her next-door neighbour at around 11:30 p.m. No one has had any contact with her since and Marie Claude left no message or clue as to her whereabouts.

Teeth: False, Upper dental prosthetic and natural lower teeth

Case reference: 2014001795.CaseDesc: John Boone has been missing since December 24, 1998, in Saint John, NB. Mr. Boone suffers from depression and reportedly was not taking his medication. Mr. Boone's family is from the St Andrews, NB area.

Case reference: 2017021464.CaseDesc: Since April 14, 2017, Deborah Anne Hutchinson's family has not seen or heard from her. Deborah's vehicle was later located in the Cossitt Heights area.

Case reference: 2006018599.CaseDesc: Richard Rees and Gregory Cook were last seen on July 17, 1998, leaving Sunnyside Beach, Nottawasaga Bay in Meaford, Ontario in a Schwill DS16 sailboat. The overturned sailboat was recovered, but Richard and Gregory have not been located.

Mark: Upper Back, pale birthmark on right side

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2014006419.CaseDesc: On January 23, 2014, Ally Hassan Mabruki was seen for the last time at one of Toronto's Refugee Intake Shelters in Ontario. Staff members overheard Ally stating he was going to visit his lawyer regarding his refugee claim.

Case reference: 2013000117.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1960, police received a report of a lost child in the Red Lake area, 72 km Northwest of Kamloops. 21-month-old Edna Bette-Jean Masters known to the family as Bette-Jean, was last seen playing with family and friends at a friend's residence.

Deformity: Ears, Slight bent ear lobe, unknown which ear
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Oval shape burn scar

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2022064778.CaseDesc: Justin McMillan was last seen at his home in Keswick Ridge, New Brunswick, on December 19th, 2022. Law enforcement has explored numerous avenues to locate Justin with no success.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Puffy style winter jacket
Tattoo: Left Eye, Tear drop and cross

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black
Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2007004799.CaseDesc: Stacy Dilenardi was last seen on November 28, 2005, purchasing some cigarettes at a gas bar in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario (Garden River). He had just moved to Sault Ste. Marie and had recently started a job as a technician with the Ontario Forest Research Institute. Stacy had spoken to his father the day before his disappearance. On November 30, 2005, investigators located his vehicle north of the city on a snowmobile trail.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2022018590.CaseDesc: Xiao Hua Jiang, who goes by her English name “Christina”, was last seen at approximately 1am on April 27, 2022 in West Vancouver, British Columbia. On May 2, 2022, her vehicle, a grey 2021 Toyota Highlander was located abandoned on Highway 1, approximately 20 kilometres east of Rogers Pass, just outside Glacier National Park in British Columbia. The vehicle had sustained mechanical damage rendering it undriveable. Xiao Hua has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004703.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1995, Marie-Josée Boisjoli left her home in Laval, Quebec, mentioning that she was going to an appointment. The next day, her vehicle and personal belongings were found at the family cottage, located in the Gélinas Lake area in Mont-Tremblant, Quebec. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005227.CaseDesc: Carl Chenier was last seen in Montreal on February 23, 2009 by the superintendent of his apartment. It is believed that he may have mental health problems, but he was not on any medications. He often used the Montreal Metro.

Case reference: 2006016999.CaseDesc: Donald Hemsworth was last seen in the area surrounding Twitchgrass and Hilda Lakes, Farr Township on October 8, 1974.

Case reference: 2009004299.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1973, Madeleine Van Overdijk was reported missing by her husband.  She was last seen at her residence in Brantford, Ontario. Information reported to police suggested she was going to Toronto.  It is unknown if in fact she made it to Toronto.

Case reference: 2014003507.CaseDesc: On February 5, 1991, Brian Adrain was seen for the last time. Brian’s abandoned vehicle was found west of Millarville, also known as McLean Creek, in the Kananaskis area in Alberta.

Case reference: 2014000002.CaseDesc: Dennis Bastillo was living with his family at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen near the Lions Gate Bridge between Vancouver and West Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005103.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Mathieu Duguay was seen for the last time while shouting for help in Rivière-des-Prairies in Montreal, Quebec. Some of Mathieu’s personal belongings were found on the banks of the river, not far from where witnesses saw the young man disappear into the river currents. Extensive searches of the area were conducted, but he was never found.

Hat: White, Baseball cap, possibly with Montreal Expos baseball team logo

Case reference: 2019060163.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2019, Ashley Arason was seen for the last time by her family in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Ashley had missed her son’s birthday, and this was something that was out of character

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Musical notes on a staff
Left Ankle, Chinese writing, strength, butterfly, musical note

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2014004162.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1987, Charles Eddy was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Moncton, New Brunswick, where he lived with his brother. Charles suffered from partial schizophrenia, was known to be heavy smoker and carry large sums of money.

Case reference: 2014002978.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1982, a witness saw Louisette ST-ARNEAULT fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières. Her body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014005453.CaseDesc: On December 9, 2004, Sheila Adamo was seen for the last time when she left the family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. She is known to travel to the East Coast as well as into the United States.

Case reference: 2019020557.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, at 9:00 pm, Rebecca Dorman was last seen leaving a friend's residence located at the intersection of Mohawk Road East and Upper Wellington Street in Hamilton, Ontario. Rebecca had been staying with her friend, and left the residence without her shoes, purse, phone or keys.

Case reference: 2014004632.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 2005, Dean Phillips  was reported missing by his family in Campbell River, British Columbia. Dean was  last seen at a local school in Campbell River and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020024716.CaseDesc: In August 1975, David Bleaney was seen for the last time in Charleston, West Virginia, in the United States. David was born in Ontario, Canada, and had moved to the United States. During the time of his disappearance, David had failed to attend a court appearance.

Case reference: 2024017230.CaseDesc: Warren Dean left his residence in North Tonawanda at approximately 10:30 am on May 30, 1990. Warren was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, Niagara Falls, NY.  At that time Warren was believed to be despondent.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2008008498.CaseDesc: Helen Lipinski was seen for the last time on February 3, 1987 leaving the Roman Court Bingo Hall in Niagara Falls, Ontario, with her daughter. She stepped out of the hall, leaving her purse behind. Helen has a history of mental health issues. She previously mentioned wanting to visit her sister in Chihuahua, Mexico.

Jewelry: Gold, birthstone with 7 stones, 1 was missing

Case reference: 2014043144.CaseDesc: On August 3, 2014, Aaron Dragonetti was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014005589.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1971, Lillian Giroux was seen for the last time when she was left with relatives in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2016008144.CaseDesc: Ben Trommels was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario, after being dropped off at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 11, 2016.  It is believed that he left his apartment on foot that evening.  At the time of his disappearance, Ben suffered from mental health issues.

Hair: Brown, Often has a shaved head
Coat: Black, Winter coat with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014003025.CaseDesc: On March 5, 1989, Barbara McLaughlin was last seen leaving a friends residence in Roseville, Michigan in the USA.  A few days later Barbara's car was discovered on the Bluewater Bridge in Sarnia, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014002270.CaseDesc: On 2 July, 1992, Behnam Amjadi was seen for the last time when he left his residence in the Côtes-des-Neiges et Notre-Dame-de-Grace district in Montreal, Quebec. Behnam has not been seen and has not contacted his ex-spouse or his brothers in Iran since.

Case reference: 2020043711.CaseDesc: Alfred L'Arrivee was last seen on May 3, 1973 at a rural property where he resided in Keg River, Alberta. Alfred has not been seen since.
